snippet: President Bashar al-Assad’s government accused Jordan and Turkey of “playing with fire” by aiding Syrian rebels.
abstract: Syria accuses Turkey and Jordan of fomenting Syrian rebellion, threatening that they are 'playing with fire' by aiding rebels, in possible hint of retaliation; criticisms appear to be part of  intensified propaganda response to new rebel gains in two-year-old conflict and Pres Bashar al-Assad’s further isolation..

byline.contributor: Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Dubai, United Arab Emirates, and Thanassis Cambanis from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: President Bashar al-Assad’s government accused Jordan and Turkey of “playing with fire” by aiding Syrian rebels.

headline.seo: Syria Lashes Out at Jordan and Turkey
headline.main: Jordanians and Turks Are Focus of Syria’s Ire
headline.print_headline: Jordanians And Turks Are Focus Of Syria’s Ire

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
